documents.document: Alright, I'll continue this tomorrow. Thank you to all those who have liked and hope the essays/responses have come across as genuine.
@Jacobunny Just the truth, good buddy :)
@Jacobunny You see! That kindness and generosity, you were right and you are the fucking best!
@Jacobunny P.S Thank you for sending that film info over. Next week, I'm watching em, I promise. I trust your opinion!
@Jacobunny film reviews. You're greater than awesome and I'm so grateful that you follow me and put up with my bullshit tweets
@Jacobunny and support and you've never stopped with every response you've ever sent to me. I also love your grounded yet genuine film
@Jacobunny You. You were the first one to offer a place to stay/take me in and encourage my insanity. That is such a great act of kindness
@Jacobunny I don't know if you remember this but almost 2 years ago, I declared that I was considering visiting NZ for NZ Film Fest
@TyleKurner came to be. In other words, I've always read your work and your thoughts on film and it's always spoken to me so thank you
@TyleKurner Scorsese boring whilst most found that to be blasphemy) & how it was impossible to objectify the male body until Magic Mike XXL
@TyleKurner out bullshit on sensationalized straight male masculinity in film (re you being the only one I saw who admitted to finding some
@TyleKurner Oh Kyle, why have I not spoken to you in ages? To start, you were one of the first people I saw on here that challenged & called
@smolexH Just the truth :)
@erin_beeee catch up and talk movies and your greatness!
@erin_beeee I thank you so damn much for following me, being so supportive and so goddamn lovely! And on my next Canberra trip, we gonna
@erin_beeee Gave some wonderfulish advice about AFTRS, and always favourite my rambling movie bullshit & bad jokes
@erin_beeee Speaking of supportive, You! Wonderful kind person you. Only following me for a month or so you got my producer call out asap
@BrionyKidd Thank you and I hope the positivity sticks and gets you to create great art!
@smolexH Always friendly and having now met you in person, it's all there and more in person. Alex, you are so damn cool, never forget this!
@smolexH ...& then I read them. You're a meticulous, concise, considerate & most of all great writer who is ALWAYS honest, always supportive
@smolexH post your reviews and how often you'd share em (There were so many) I found it refreshing to see a writer share their work so much
@smolexH When you first followed me and I followed back (Or it could've been the other way around) I remember how excitable you were to
@BrionyKidd But please let me be the one to say, for the future of my film viewing and making, please make another film asap!....please :)
@BrionyKidd display and any grand comments or thoughts can be channeled in a piece of your own work. It's still hard concentrating though
@BrionyKidd Aahh I am semi in the same boat but more in the edit room. It's a good thing in some ways, re it keeps energy up, emotions on
@BrionyKidd It really did. It was really great work and I'm so damn excited to see your next film!
@BrionyKidd you have on here multiple times and just overall being inspiring and amazing. Please make more movies. Forever, if possible.
@BrionyKidd But on top of that, I have to thank you for your amaxing festival and for ALWAYS supporting filmmakers including myself (Which
@BrionyKidd taught me something. It taught me to be patient with every scene and reminded me to embrace silence. I love that movie
@BrionyKidd That movie was The Room At The Top Of The Stairs. I was a month away from shooting my first proper short with a budget and it
@BrionyKidd So, I don't know if I ever told you this but I owe you a huge thank you. You once sent me one of your short films without q
I absolutely love this Cannes poster for PATERSON https://t.co/qttDiR4N8z
@adlow76 Where???
@JEBermanator You need to please please send me that one day!
@thatcinefileguy film insights!
@thatcinefileguy engaged and appreciated differing film opinions. Bravo good buddy, it'll be a pleasure to continue excitedly awaiting your
@thatcinefileguy word on great cinema and above all, always being supportive. Film Twitter can be mean and bullshit sometimes, you've always
@thatcinefileguy while I have yet to apologize, I have to say thank you for your wonderful movie insights, your dedication to spreading the
@thatcinefileguy We have been followin' each other for a lllooonnngggg damn time, I mean you've had to read my shit since the beginning
@laureningram Haha just the truth/thank you for reading!
@laureningram And sorry for the 800 tweet long essay and for my overuse of the word Incredible but you are...fucking awesome. (Honestly)
@laureningram when it seems like no one can or does and thank you for following me and putting up with my bullshit tweets
@laureningram PLEASE keep offering every idea, thought and response you have. It has helped me through bullshit days and provides reason
@laureningram effortlessly is incredible & your bravery & dedication to what you preach is beyond incredible. Please PLEASE keep tweeting
@laureningram insights, wisdom, perception, consideration and knowledge. I mean it, the way you respond to people and support them almost
@laureningram and followed your tweets, let me say with all great honesty, I am so fortunate and not grateful enough to have your incredible
@laureningram and loved all the things I've said about his work from 16 onwards was amazing to see/Respond to. So now having read your work
@laureningram in some way or another sung your praises. (Your fanbase is incredible, goddamn). And seeing that you also dug Chuck Palahniuk
@laureningram So, I followed you because I had seen your writings shared around by many friends and half of the people I follow on here
And I do promise to respond to every. Single. Damn. One. No matter how long it takes (18 weeks later: "U R Tops")
Also, yay more favouriters! Keep em comin'
Re these responses. If you've followed me longer than a week, you know I can't summarize anything in a single tweet. Excuse the essays.
@JEBermanator bullshit I write so Thank you for still following and favouriting this, good buddy! Also, have you seen Southland Tales?
@JEBermanator film recommendations and quiet yet appreciated little favourites and responses of support in the endless amount of
@JEBermanator So over what's been a good 6 years of Twitter followin', I've seen similarities in our film tastes, your amazing
@JEBermanator Following and had this moment of "Oh goddamn, I'm one of the chosen ones! Be cool, Christoph. @ So u like Southland Tales?"
@JEBermanator You know, you were one of my very first followers on here. No shit. I remember seeing how many followers you had compared to
@youwontknow Oh and P.S, come say hi to us all at SFF!
@youwontknow keep talking movies. Keep comin' with the funny Twitter replies. They are VERY much appreciated. ..Sorry for the essay.
@youwontknow were no fluke. You have incredible skills despite keeping them hidden from time to time. Please don't. Keep writing.
@youwontknow Are in fact, one HELL of a writer and your modest yet incredibly insightful, perceptive and well thought out mini tweet reviews
@youwontknow "Rebecca - Not a writer" - Only from one fucking article which I have shared around and read more tjan twice do I know that you
@youwontknow "fashion over & over". You wrote that. A small snippet from what was one of the best articles I've read. And it's signed off by
@youwontknow "We see all kinds of stories on screen, all different kinds of sex, yet birth is portrayed in this one-dimensional" (1/2)
@youwontknow Oooo well then
Alright, sorry for the delay. This day has been 46 different kids of bullshit. Here we go
@beer_movie @erin_beeee @debbie_zhou Also, that was the compliment you fav'd for
@beer_movie @erin_beeee @debbie_zhou (Cont'd) Please do not release Knight Of Flops despite my colleague TimBeer4U2c2001's letters of demand
@aWomanUnderThe Holy shit, Preach!
@erin_beeee @debbie_zhou @beer_movie Thanks for ganging up on me, VULTURES. *Continues writing letter to Criterion demanding SFITY release*

I love that people are slowly favouriting this throughout the day.
Shall be sending these through tonight! I promise.
Bump de bump. I'm feeling complimentary.
@Jacobunny Aayyeee ok stay tuned! Also, please remind me of that rare movie you love/recommended me a while back

Even if you don't interact with my tweets a huge lot, doesn't matter. I'm sure I'll have something to say.
Favourite away!
My responses, if anyone can be bothered to fav this may take some time, but it just means I'm thinking of the best compliment imaginable

If you favourite this, I will send you an honest compliment
You all have improved many of my days somehow or way, let me return the favour
Fuck it, why not.
@KateJFitz01 Rectify both!! (The movie is decent! Even if it may evoke some annoying/not great memories) You should definitely hit up Bath
Might be a good time to do this again (Can't find the original tweet) https://t.co/acVSH8q8nS
@KateJFitz01 The film and Bath, I mean.
@KateJFitz01 Oh wowww that sucks! And to add to it, of all movies, one as depressing and low key as the one he chose. Did you ever revisit
@episode2480 I can imagine! My flashback memories of that film are all intense, awkward scenes
@lisamalouf Malcom's a great movie as well! (Definitely not suited)
@lisamalouf A few of these answers have popped up re dates who declared disinterest in cinema after seeing a movie.
@lisamalouf The one HUGE drawback of Govindas and that sounds like the most unfortunate date of all time
@LA_Fairweather I was in the minority at the time. Everyone loved it. I loved Goodman's monents. Denzel was great. Not a Zemeckis fan!
@EddieWhiteJr As far as movies go, you got lucky at least
@alexxkittle It really was! (Made my Jan list also)
@episode2480 Nope. This wins. Bravo! I love how it's that scene that tops what was probably already an uncomfortable 2 hour film.
@Anotherfilmnerd Thank you for informing me, good buddy. I could do with a 57th rewatch
@Anotherfilmnerd @FilmMomatic As was AMERICAN SNIPER the very next day...
Best answers: - Hannah Montana The Major Motion Picture - The Inbetweeners 2 - Come & See - Punch Drunk Love - Anything with subtitles
@Tim_Coronel @registradus Woah! How'd they find it?
@LA_Fairweather Oooo we finally disagree on a film. I hated Flight! (& that was a film me & my still girlfriend saw and both did not dig)
@karenyhan Bit of both and thank you!!
Top 5 January First Viewings: 1. MOONLIGHT 2. JACKIE 3. LAW OF DESIRE 4. FARGO S2 5. XXX: RETURN OF XANADU CAGE
@jocelynseip It was a beautiful thing to hear, we still friends, thankfully!
@jocelynseip He stood in the foyer on the cinema and said "Nup. Sorry. What if someone see's me?" - She called him an impotent weenie aloud
@jocelynseip Re it being the other way around. A friend of mine dumped her boyfriend because he refused to see Elizabeth: The Golden Age
@jocelynseip Yes!! Same here, they should just never commit the cardinal sin of being both cheap and boring!
